dublinCore.dc:title: 119 S2824 IS: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the temporary enhanced premium credits.
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Ms. Murkowski introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend the temporary enhanced premium credits.

section.header: Extension of temporary enhanced premium credits

subsection.text: Clause (iii) of section 36B(b)(3)(A) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking January 1, 2026 and inserting January 1, 2028, and
by striking 2025 in the heading and inserting 2027.

subsection.header: Taxpayers whose household income exceeds 400 percent of the poverty line
subsection.text: Section 36B(c)(1)(E) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking January 1, 2026 and inserting January 1, 2028, and
by striking 2025 in the heading and inserting 2027.

subsection.text: The amendments made by this section shall apply to taxable years beginning after December 31, 2025.
